    Research

    I am currently working developing XXX, a human-centered, knowledge-driven, reasoning-based system for detecting, characterizing, and mitigating unknown unknowns in machine learning. This effort evloves from several interweaved research topics I have worked on in the past: 1) accelerating crowd knowledge creation, 2) machine learning from small, sparse, and noisy data, and 3) integrating human computation and machine learning.

    My research is motivated by real-world tasks in natural language processing and recommender systems and finds application across a variety of domains, including but not limited to health, finance, mobility, education, and retail.

    Projects

    Integrating Human Computation and Machine Learing

  • Bayesian model training framework with humans in the loop (WWW2020)
  • Structured probabilistic end-to-end learning from crowds (IJCAI2020)
  • Human-AI loop approaches for social event detection (AAAI2020)
  • Learning from targeted crowds - an application in Alexa (WWW2018)

    • Learning from Small, Sparse, and Noisy Data

  • Web-to-Voice transfer for voice recommendation (SIGIR2020)
  • Training data augmentation for medical effects detection (EMNLP2019)
  • Debugging noisy training data for language tasks (WWW2019)
  • Deep active learning for link prediction in knowledge graphs (WWW2019)

    • Crowd Knowledge Creation Acceleration

  • Understanding worker communities in microtask markets (HCOMP2018)
  • Modeling task clarity in crowdsourcing (HyperText2017)
  • Modeling task complexity in crowdsourcing (HCOMP2016)
  • Harnessing engagement for knowledge creation acceleration (UMAP2015)
  • Asking the right question in collaborative Q&A systems (HyperText2014)
  • Characterising expert behaviour in collaborative Q&A systems (UMAP2014)

    • Recommendation with Side Information

  • Hypergraph embedding for location prediction (WWW2019)
  • Recurrent knowledge graph embedding for recommendation (RecSys2018)
  • Interacting attention-gated recurrent networks for recommendation (CIKM2017)
  • Exploiting horizontal dimensions of feature hierarchies (AAAI2017)
  • Multi-level representation learning for personalized ranking (IJCAI2017)
  • Learning hierarchical feature influence for recommendation (RecSys2016)
